org.apache.reef.driver.evaluator

Interface AllocatedEvaluator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, ContextAndTaskSubmittable, ContextSubmittable, Identifiable, TaskSubmittable

    public interface AllocatedEvaluator
extends AutoCloseable, Identifiable, ContextSubmittable, ContextAndTaskSubmittable, TaskSubmittable
    Represents an Evaluator that is allocated, but is not running yet.

    • Method Summary

      • submitTask

        void submitTask(Configuration taskConfiguration)
        Submits the given Task for execution.

        This generates a ContextConfiguration for the root context with a generated ID derived from the EvaluatorId.

        Specified by:

      • submitContextAndTask

        void submitContextAndTask(Configuration contextConfiguration,
                        Configuration taskConfiguration)
        Description copied from interface: ContextAndTaskSubmittable
        Submit a Context and a Task.

        The semantics of this call are the same as first submitting the context and then, on the fired ActiveContext event to submit the Task. The performance of this will be better, though as it potentially saves some roundtrips on the network.

        REEF will not fire an ActiveContext as a result of this. Instead, it will fire a TaskRunning event.

        Specified by:
        submitContextAndTask in interface ContextAndTaskSubmittable
        Parameters:
        contextConfiguration - the Configuration of the EvaluatorContext. See ContextConfiguration for details.
        taskConfiguration - the Configuration of the Task. See TaskConfiguration for details.

      • submitContextAndServiceAndTask

        void submitContextAndServiceAndTask(Configuration contextConfiguration,
                                  Configuration serviceConfiguration,
                                  Configuration taskConfiguration)
        Description copied from interface: ContextAndTaskSubmittable
        Subkit a Context with Services and a Task.

        The semantics of this call are the same as first submitting the context and services and then, on the fired ActiveContext event to submit the Task. The performance of this will be better, though as it potentially saves some roundtrips on the network.

        REEF will not fire an ActiveContext as a result of this. Instead, it will fire a TaskRunning event.

        Specified by:
        submitContextAndServiceAndTask in interface ContextAndTaskSubmittable
